Hello,

Im trying to login use simple-salesforce and getting below error:
simple_salesforce.login.SalesforceAuthenticationFailed: INVALID_LOGIN: Invalid username, password, security token; or user locked out. I am using python 2.7.11. I am using security_token and its valid. Should I be passing a domain ? 

Error:
File "/apps/salesforce/simple_salesforce/api.py", line 147, in __init__
    domain=self.domain)
  File "/apps/salesforce/simple_salesforce/login.py", line 175, in SalesforceLogin
    raise SalesforceAuthenticationFailed(except_code, except_msg)
simple_salesforce.exceptions.SalesforceAuthenticationFailed: INVALID_LOGIN: Invalid username, password, security token; or user locked out.

items.title: Use session_id from Salesforce to authenticate ?
items.body:
Hello,

I'd like to use simple-salesforce  to act as the user triggering actions from Salesforce.

For instance, an api call is made from SF to Python, and then I'd like to create an account from Python.

I'm passing the session_id from the  UserInfo.getSessionId() from Salesforce as a header in my api call to Python, but then I'm unable to use simple-salesforce to act as the originating user.

How should I do so ?

I've read https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/issues/107 and https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/pull/128 but I don't manage to authenticate, I have an invalid session id error.

I've tried:
```
Salesforce(instance_url="https://cs128.salesforce.com", session_id=session_id)
Salesforce(instance_url="https://cs128.salesforce.com", session_id=session_id, domain='test')
Salesforce(instance="test.salesforce.com", session_id=session_id, domain='test')
Salesforce(instance="test.salesforce.com", session_id=session_id)
```

All of those fail

items.title: Enhancement: Quoting/escaping for SOQL values and external IDs
items.body:
To effectively use `query()` at all or use external IDs with `upsert()` or `get()`, quoting/escaping must be applied. Think it would be good for this to be built into the library, either as helpers or built into these functions. Otherwise it has to be redone in every implementation.

Willing to contribute a PR. Helpers would be easy... looks like building into `query()` would be possible though it already uses `**kwargs` for something else so it would need to be a specific named argument.

items.title: Lazy loading not available in v1.0.0
items.body:
According to the changelog https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/blob/master/CHANGES, lazy loading (query_all_iter) was added in v0.75
But it's not even available in v1.0.0 on pypi. The pull request for this feature was merged May 5, the pypi v1.0.0 release is dated March 20.

It's referenced in the docs already as well https://simple-salesforce.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide/queries.html

items.title: Bulk Update 10000+ records
items.body:
I'm having an issue with attempting to bulk update 10000+ records. Below is the code I'm running:

```
data = []
record_counter = 0
print("Total Records: {0}".format(len(results)))
for(col1, col2) in results:
    if record_counter < 10000:
        record = {}
        record['Id'] = col1
        record['score__c'] = col2
        data.append(record)
        record_counter += 1
    else:
        print("Updating {0} records".format(record_counter))
        sf.bulk.Health_Score__c.update(data)
        data = []
        record_counter = 0
```

The output from this is 
`
Total Records: 10457
Updating 10000 records
`
I would expect that after uploading the first batch of 10000, it would loop back to the top and continue on for the other 457 records, however the program simply ends after completing the first upload of 10000 (and no longer prints the results I've noticed...) I'm unfortunately not really much of a programmer. Is there a better way to be achieving this? Thanks so much for input!

items.title: invalid session id on bulk upload
items.body:
I'm getting an invalid session ID when I try to bulk upload a somewhat complex piece of data to a custom table. For straightforward data to a default table (Contacts) I do not get an error.

```
sf = Salesforce(username='xxxxx', password='xxxxxxx', security_token='xxxxxx', domain='test')
sf.bulk.Contact.upsert(data, 'ak_user_id2__c') #works fine

table2 = { 'item1': {
        'ak_transaction_id__c': '2',
        'contact_r': {'ak_user_id2__c': '7'}, # the one piece of weird data
        'name': 'Recurring 28000817',
        'amount__c': '10.0'
       }}

sf.bulk.donation__c.upsert(table2, 'ak_transaction_id__c') # this fails
```
Salesforce is https://cs54.salesforce.com/ if that matters
The error message is "InvalidSessionId."

I should also note that I'm working on code someone else developed, so I am kind of fumbling around generally

items.title: How to retrieve a File uploaded to Files and added to Contracts..
items.body:
Hi all,

I have the following python code using ssimple-salesforce module:

```
def get_email_template(sf, agreement_id):
    email_templates = sf.query(f"""
            SELECT VersionData, Title, PathOnClient
            FROM ContentVersion
            WHERE FirstPublishLocationId = '{agreement_id}'
            AND pathonclient = 'email_template.html'
    """)['records']

    if len(email_templates) != 0:
        return base64.b64decode(email_templates[0]['VersionData'])
    return None

# end get_email_template

```
I am getting the following error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\code\Python\social\social_messaging.py", line 293, in <module>
    email_template = get_email_template(sf, agreement_id)
  File "c:\code\Python\social\social_messaging.py", line 113, in get_email_template
    return base64.b64decode(email_templates[0]['VersionData'])
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\base64.py", line 87, in b64decode
    return binascii.a2b_base64(s)
binascii.Error: Incorrect padding
```

I must be doing some thing wrong with the base64decode which I am not sure. 

Any help is greatly appreciated.
Thanks,

items.title: Issue - Bulk API Upsert/Insert Fails with Json Deserialization
items.body:
Thanks for the great tools and I have been using it for our prod system for 3+ months now.

I had the same error which AAraKKe mentioned on his issues #366 as well when I use a limited number of data for my testing with my full data which is 26K+ records I don't see that issue. Don't want to get into that debugging now.

The other issue that I have been trying to solve for almost 2 days now is described below.
We have a custom salesforce Object and I am trying to load data into it using bulk upsert API, I get the following error for all the rows, its the same error message from SF -> Bulk job -> view result page as well
`ERROR - {"success": false, "created": false, "id": null, "errors": [{"message": "Unexpected JsonMappingException: No such column 'Car_Type__c' on sobject of type Text_Message__c", "fields": [], "statusCode": "INVALID_FIELD", "extendedErrorDetails": null}]}`

The SF Object column that I want to upsert are:

Dealer_ID__c | Number(18, 0)
Account__c | Lookup(Account)
Exception_Inv_Cnt__c | Number(18, 0)
Exception_Text__c | Text(255)
Exception_Type__c | Text(255)
Grain_Type__c | Text(40)
Make__c | Text(255)
Text_ID__c | Number(18, 0)  (External ID)
Vehicle_Segment__c | Text(255)

I have tried to upsert with just individual columns to the SF object just to see if I am able to and I was successful with two columns Text_ID__c and Grain_Type__c alone passing other columns in the upsert input fails with the above error.

I have attached the sample JSON data herewith for reference.
[sf_data.txt](https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/files/4384533/sf_data.txt)

What could I be doing wrong here? 
Any help or direction would be appreciated.

items.title: Issue when using bulk api to insert data
items.body:
Hi! Thanks a lot for this great tool! 
I just discovered it and I am doing some tests to try and use it for bulk APIs updates. I am sorry if this has been posted or clarified before, I could not find anything. 

I can do mostly everything, bulk querying included, but when I try to make a bulk insert the call fails with the error

`{'exceptionCode': 'InvalidBatch', 'exceptionMessage': 'Records not processed'}`

The batch I am running as a test is like this:

```python
bulk = []
for dd in range(10):
    tldate = dt.datetime(2019,1,1) + dt.timedelta(days=dd)
    teledata = {
        'DAU__c': 10,
        'MAU__c': 30,
        'WAU__c': 20,
        'AccountId__c': '0010o00002haQFOAA2',
        'Telemetry_Date__c': tldate.isoformat()
    }
    bulk.append(teledata)

client.bulk.TelemetryData__c.insert(teledata)
```

Basically, I am trying to insert custom objects to a given account. If I create one by one it works fine but when using the bulk api to insert it the error appears. I am not sure what I am doing wrong. The ORG has the object active for bulk api usage. I can query it using bulk:

```python
client.bulk.TelemetryData__c.query('SELECT WAU__c, Name FROM TelemetryData__c LIMIT 10')
>>> [{'attributes': {'type': 'TelemetryData__c',
   'url': '/services/data/v38.0/sobjects/TelemetryData__c/a000o00004cn2Y4AAI'},
  'WAU__c': 20.0,
  'Name': 'TD-00000022'},
 {'attributes': {'type': 'TelemetryData__c',
   'url': '/services/data/v38.0/sobjects/TelemetryData__c/a000o00004cn2k0AAA'},
  'WAU__c': 20.0,
  'Name': 'TD-00000023'},
 {'attributes': {'type': 'TelemetryData__c',
   'url': '/services/data/v38.0/sobjects/TelemetryData__c/a000o00004cn2kAAAQ'},
  'WAU__c': 20.0,
  'Name': 'TD-00000024'}]
```

Those are the entires I just created one by one with no problem at all. Do you know what the issue might be? Thanks!

items.title: Travis Configuration Warnings
items.body:
3 problems with our travis file:

(1) We aren't specifying the operating system (`linux`)
(2) We're using `user` instead of `username` in our deploy
(3) We're using `matrix` instead of `jobs`

![Screen Shot 2020-02-29 at 6 33 00 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/474748/75616669-0e96c900-5b22-11ea-9637-1ccb6f14fcdd.png)

items.title: Sort imports
items.body: We should run isort on the codebase so that our imports are cleaner.

items.title: Increase the default Salesforce API Version
items.body:
Our current default API version os `38.0` which appears to be from [2017](https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=000334996&type=1&mode=1)

We can probably bump that to `42.0` maybe? That's Spring 2018.

items.title: Bump the version to 1.0
items.body: Once we remove support for EOL'd python ( #358 ) , bump to a new version of requests ( #359 ), move to a newer version of the Salesforce API ( #362 ), and remove the depreciated interfaces ( #360 ) I think we can bump to 1.0

items.title: Remove deprecated interfaces
items.body: It has been a few years, we can finally get rid of `SalesforceAPI` and the `request` property on `Salesforce` from `api.py`, especially if we bump the version to 1.x

items.title: Replace requests[security] with requests above `2.22.0`
items.body:
We should be able to get away with just requiring `requests` above `2.22.0` (released in early 2019) instead of `requests[security]`

Closes #304

items.title: Remove Support for Python 2.6, 2.7, 3.3, and 3.4
items.body:
2.6, 2.7, 3.3, and 3.4 are all EOL'd. We should remove support for them.

Closes #234

items.title: Adding concurrency mode as parameter to do serial upload
items.body:
Hello,

Sometimes we may want for legitimate reasons to do serial upload instead of parallel.
As per this thread this can be done editing the _create_job__ module: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57960907/python-simple-salesforce-change-concurrencymode

Can this feature be integrated into the project, I think it could be helpful to everyone

thanks

items.title: `CANNOT_UPDATE_CONVERTED_LEAD` when trying to update a lead
items.body:
`simple-salesforce` should ideally have a check to see if a lead, is converted or not, and then only proceed with the update request https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/blob/master/simple_salesforce/api.py#L714

This will prevent callers to have to do their own redundant checking all over the place.

items.title: constant API calls / logins
items.body:
Hello! We are trying to upsert ~20k records to a Salesforce object, and ~180k records to another object using the simple-salesforce API. My understanding is that each batch is capped at 10k records, and the bulk.upsert method will upsert 10k for a batch, give this error `InvalidBatch : Exceeded number of records : 10002. Number of records should be less than or equal to 10001`, and then continue to another job with one batch of 10k. Is there a way to group all of the batches under one job?

We are also experiencing constant API logins using the credentials provided to the Salesforce object instance, about one login every 2 seconds to a minute or so, even though our Python callable should only run once an hour. We don't want to exceed our login limit, so we've disabled this for now. 

Are these two issues above related / does anyone have any advice to resolve this? Would be greatly appreciated.

Is there a way to just get the JSON payload without having it do the conversion to a dict?

items.title: Bulk API will not return records from a subtable of a custom object
items.body:
I am using the bulk API to return records programmatically.

In this case I want to get records from `Program_Budget__c`, which is a subtable of custom object `Program__c`:

```
# budget_downloader.py
from simple_salesforce import Salesforce, SFType, SalesforceLogin

my_sf_email = os.environ["SALESFORCE_EMAIL"]
my_sf_password = os.environ["SALESFORCE_PASSWORD"]
my_sf_token = os.environ["SALESFORCE_TOKEN"]

session_id, instance = SalesforceLogin(username=my_sf_email,
                                       password=my_sf_password,
                                       security_token=my_sf_token,
                                       sandbox=False)
sf = Salesforce(instance=instance, session_id=session_id)

my_query = "SELECT Id FROM Program_Budget__c"
response = sf.bulk.Program__c.query(my_query)
```
then:

```
> python budget_downloader.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "budget_downloader.py", line 62, in <module>
   response = sf.bulk.Program__c.query(program_query_budget)
 File "C:\github\salesforce-data-collector\lib\site-packages\simple_salesforce\bulk.py", line 237, in query
   operation='query', data=data)
 File "C:\github\salesforce-data-collector\lib\site-packages\simple_salesforce\bulk.py", line 198, in _bulk_operation
   operation=operation)
 File "C:\github\salesforce-data-collector\lib\site-packages\simple_salesforce\bulk.py", line 157, in _get_batch_results
   url_query_results = "{}{}{}".format(url, '/', result.json()[0])
IndexError: list index out of range
```

From Salesforce Workbench, though, this returns records:

```
Select Id FROM Program_Budget__c
```

Same with the Dev Console:

```
Select Id FROM Program_Budget__c
```

returns records.

Can someone help me troubleshoot why this query works in the Dev Console and Workbench but not via `simple_salesforce`?

items.title: Python2 support
items.body:
Can we drop Python2 support? 

Per python.org "Python 2.7 will not be maintained past 2020". There are several projects now that have dropped support for py2. No new development should be occurring in the community on this version; short of converting the code to py3.

items.title: Is there any way to call bulk api asynchronously
Info how to login
items.body:
I spent few hours in order to find info how to connect to SalesForce.
Here is the summary.

```
from simple_salesforce import Salesforce

email = user@gmail.com
password = 'your_password'
security_token = 'admlnlkrsl'

sf = Salesforce(username=email, password=password, security_token=security_token)
```

**Where to find `security token`?**

In SalesForce, using `Lightning` Theme (this is the current one, ie "modern"):

  1. Click in the top right corner your `profile icon` -> `Settings`;
  2. In the tree select `My Personal Information` -> `Reset My Security Token`;
  3. Click `Reset Security Token`;
  4. Check your email for a new token.

items.title: Bulk Query returns DateTime values as integers
items.body:
Given a connection:

    connection = Salesforce(
          instance_url=os.environ['INSTANCE_URL'],
          session_id=os.environ['ACCESS_TOKEN']
     )

executing a Bulk API query that includes DateTime fields returns integer values of unclear meaning rather than the expected ISO-format string.

    connection.bulk.Account.query('SELECT Name, CreatedDate, LastModifiedDate, SystemModStamp FROM Account')

> [{'CreatedDate': 1546659665000, 'SystemModstamp': 1546659665000, 'attributes': {'url': '/services/data/v38.0/sobjects/Account/0010R00000VsXkHQAV','type': 'Account'}, 'Name': 'ACME', 'LastModifiedDate': 1546659665000}, ... ]

Performing the same query with the REST API yields correct results:

> [OrderedDict([('attributes', OrderedDict([('type', 'Account'), ('url', '/services/data/v38.0/sobjects/Account/0010R00000VsXkHQAV')])), ('Name', 'ACME'), ('CreatedDate', '2019-01-05T03:41:05.000+0000'), ...

Changing the API version from 38.0 to 44.0 does not affect the behavior.

I'm using simple_salesforce-0.74.2, Python 3.5.2, and Ubuntu 16.04.

items.title: sObject is not supported error in query - why?
items.body:
I'm trying to run a query that should just return an id so I think my lack of understanding about the internals has me confused by this message.

```
repository_id = sf1.query(
    "SELECT Id FROM ContentHubRepository WHERE Type='contentHubQuip' LIMIT 1")
```

Error is:
```
simple_salesforce.api.SalesforceGeneralError: [ {
  "message" : "sObject type 'ContentHubRepository' is not supported.",
  "errorCode" : "INVALID_TYPE"
}
```

I'm not sure why the library needs to understand a schema in order to execute a SQL query. Is there any way to execute a raw query perhaps? Advice on moving forward? This query does work in the Dev Console. 

Thanks for the cool library!

items.title: Bulk upsert documentation example is incorrect
items.body:
On the main page of the documentation the example:

Upsert records:

```
data = [{'Id': '0000000000AAAAA', 'Email': 'examplenew2@example.com'}, {'Id': '', 'Email': 'foo@foo.com'}]

sf.bulk.Contact.upsert(data, 'Id')
```
is incorrect. It should be:

```
data = [{'Id': '0000000000AAAAA', 'Email': 'examplenew2@example.com'}, {'Email': 'foo@foo.com'}]

sf.bulk.Contact.upsert(data, 'Id')
```
i.e. with no 'Id' field to create new records.

Please check #232

items.title: Help using restful function -- invalid dates
items.body:
Hey. I keep having an issue with the following code --

    from simple_salesforce.api import Salesforce
    from simple_salesforce.util import date_to_iso8601
    sforce = Salesforce(
        session=requests.Session(),
        username=USERNAME,
        password=PASSWORD,
        security_token=SECURITY_TOKEN
    )
    
    end_time = datetime.now(pytz.UTC)
    start_time = end_time - timedelta(days=1)
    print(date_to_iso8601(start_time))
    print(date_to_iso8601(end_time))
    params = {
            'start': date_to_iso8601(start_time),
            'end': date_to_iso8601(end_time)
    }
    ids = sforce.restful(
        'sobjects/ContactHistory/updated/',
        params=params
    )

I keep getting the error 'Malformed Request, start date is not in the correct format'. I'm trying to format the date using simple-salesforce's own date_to_iso8601 function and I'm converting it to UTC, but I'm not too sure what I'm doing wrong.

I would appreciate any help or insight into this. If there's some documentation that goes over using the restful function call with dates, that would be helpful too.

items.title: Fix README.rst Rendering on PyPi

items.title: Drop Python 3.3 support
items.body: Python 3.3 was EOL'd in September 2017.  In https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/pull/225 it was removed from Travis CI.  This issue is to remove it in setup.py, docs, everywhere else to formally deprecate support.

items.title: Bulk upsert example incorrect
items.body:
In the Readme, the bulk upsert data example is as follows:

```python
data = [
  {'Id': '0000000000AAAAA', 'Email': 'examplenew2@example.com'},
  {'Id': '', 'Email': 'foo@foo.com'}
]
```
based on my testing and usage of this query, dictionaries that had `'Id': ''` were not actually inserted. Only by removing the `Id` key was I able to get it to work. 

I'm happy to make the PR to update this unless there's something I'm missing.

items.title: SalesforceGeneralError parameters out of order in Salesforce.restful
items.body:
`Salesforce.restful` seems to raise a `SalesforceGeneralError` [here](https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/blob/dda2708f13e815566f87f182601d23717797632b/simple_salesforce/api.py#L293) but the ordering of the parameters looks wrong. I think it should be 

```py
SalesforceGeneralError(
    url,
    response.status_code,
    path,
    response.content,
)
```

but right now status code and path are swapped. See [SalesforceError](https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/blob/dda2708f13e815566f87f182601d23717797632b/simple_salesforce/exceptions.py#L9)'s `__init__`.

items.title: Support for Bulk Query PK Chunking w/ Foundation for Batches
items.body:
I would like to propose support for PK Chunking with the foundations of code that would support submitting multiple batches to a single job. This code change allows a user to stream a query to line delimited JSON in order to keep a lower memory footprint on large datasets.

PK Chunking
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_asynch.meta/api_asynch/asynch_api_code_curl_walkthrough_pk_chunking.htm#!

Branch
https://github.com/astronomerio/simple-salesforce/tree/implement-bulk-query-streaming

items.title: Did the sf.limits() method get removed?
items.body:
There used to be a method called `limits` to fetch Salesforce limits. This one.

```
def limits(self):
        """Returns API limit object
        """
        url = self.base_url + "limits"
        result = self._call_salesforce('GET', url)
        if result.status_code != 200:
            raise SalesforceGeneralError(url,
                                         'limits',
                                         result.status_code,
                                         result.content)
        json_result = result.json(object_pairs_hook=OrderedDict)
        if len(json_result) == 0:
            return None
        else:
            return json_result
```

I just upgraded to the new version, and it no longer exists. I might have been using an old version(since we use it on Appengine, we store the module directly in lib/ and i don't remember what version we installed, and it's not mentioned in `__init__.py` and we didn't store setup.py in lib/)

We were using that API to fetch remaining api calls while syncing tasks, events. Is there a particular commit i can look at to see why it was removed or refactored?

Also the limit() on the older version still works for us.

items.title: Salesforce(instance, session_id) complains on subsequent query call
items.body:
When I use the instance URL and session to login a subsequent query doesn't work, but if I login using username/password/token it does work.

But of course, I want to re-use the token I already have from another process and skip having to use a security-token if I can.

I've a curl script that logs-in to Salesforce like...

```
curl https://$2.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/token \
	-d "grant_type=password" \
	--data-urlencode "client_id=$CLIENTID" \
	--data-urlencode "client_secret=$CLIENTSECRET" \
	--data-urlencode "username=$1" \
	--data-urlencode "password=$SFPASS" \
	-o login.answer
```
The resulting file (login.answer) has an instance url and session returned by Salesforce.

```
cat login.answer
{"access_token":"supersecretjumbleofcharacters","instance_url":"https://cs52.salesforce.com","id":"https://test.salesforce.com/id/00D5B000000DHvWUAW/00516000007A0qfAAC","token_type":"Bearer","issued_at":"1489712412567","signature":"D5BsLMBWMqVW5/bASafLq4CPcsS4TcgSmTgMqTgptqc="}
```
Using simple-salesforce, if I try new'ing up an instance of Salesforce as in...
```
jsonString = open('./login.answer').read()
sessionInfo = json.loads(jsonString)

sf = Salesforce(instance = sessionInfo['instance_url'], session_id = sessionInfo['access_token'])
```
I don't get an error at that line, but I will as soon as I try a query...
`result = sf.query('select id, name from entitlement')`

Which then complains:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/packages/urllib3/connection.py", line 141, in _new_conn
    (self.host, self.port), self.timeout, **extra_kw)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/packages/urllib3/util/connection.py", line 60, in create_connection
    for res in socket.getaddrinfo(host, port, family, socket.SOCK_STREAM):
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.6.0_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/socket.py", line 743, in getaddrinfo
    for res in _socket.getaddrinfo(host, port, family, type, proto, flags):
socket.gaierror: [Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known
```

If I'm missing something obvious, please let me know.  I haven't touched Python in > 10 years--maybe longer.

items.title: restful() should handle non-200 success codes
items.body: There are endpoints in the Salesforce API that result in non `200` response codes (i.e. 201 from [upserts](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_rest.meta/api_rest/dome_upsert.htm)). Currently, `restful()` will result in an exception being raised if the response code is [not strictly `200`](https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/blob/ef0a9487a6cd4854466d00969c32da000d34392a/simple_salesforce/api.py#L271). This should be updated to accept anything outside of obvious error code ranges (`4xx` and `5xx`).

items.title: Why is the sf_version in the ___init__ of SFType hardcoded instead of using the global DEFAULT_API_VERSION variable?
items.body: I changed it locally to use the global variable and ran some tests with the SFType class and it all worked fine.

items.title: Query with Id IN array
items.body:
Is it possible to query where Id is in an array of Ids? For example:

```
myArray = ["1234", "1233"]
sf.query("SELECT Id, Email FROM Contact WHERE Id IN :" + myArray)
```

items.title: Handle large result sets
items.body:
### Problem

Large result sets (100K+) cause `RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object` due to [this recursion](https://github.com/simple-salesforce/simple-salesforce/blob/master/simple_salesforce/api.py#L407).
### Solution
- Use a non recursive implementation to get results
- Use a generator to process results in small batches rather than holding the entire result set in memory

items.title: Doesn't seem to work on ARM arch
items.body:
```
    arm-linux-gnueabihf-gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes
 -fno-strict-aliasing -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat 
-Werror=format-security -fPIC -DUSE__THREAD -I/usr/include/ffi -I/usr/include/libffi
 -I/usr/include/python2.7 -c c/_cffi_backend.c 
-o build/temp.linux-armv7l-2.7/c/_cffi_backend.o
    c/_cffi_backend.c:15:17: fatal error: ffi.h: No such file or directory
     #include <ffi.h>
                     ^
    compilation terminated.
    error: command 'arm-linux-gnueabihf-gcc' failed with exit status 1
```

Anything that needs to be done to get this installing on arm architecture?

items.title: Salesforce Sandbox mode and TLS 1.0 on both python 2.x and 3.x
items.body:
$ python simple_sfdc.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "simple_sfdc.py", line 9, in <module>
    sf = Salesforce(username='xxxx', password='xxxx', security_token='xxxx', sandbox = True)
  File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/simple_salesforce/api.py", line 92, in **init**
    proxies=self.proxies)
  File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/simple_salesforce/login.py", line 135, in SalesforceLogin
    raise SalesforceAuthenticationFailed(except_code, except_msg)
simple_salesforce.login.SalesforceAuthenticationFailed: UNSUPPORTED_CLIENT: TLS 1.0 has been disabled in this organization. Please use TLS 1.1 or higher when connecting to Salesforce using https.

Facing the above issue for salesforce sandbox mode. Using the latest 0.69 version of simple_salesforce. 
P.S. The production version is working fine.

items.title: ListView issue
items.body:
Is there a problem with the SF API or it's not even possible to load views?

My view is at https://na26.salesforce.com/500?fcf=00B60000007HzQE
so I am trying with:
result = sf.ListView.get("00B60000007HzQE")
print result

but get
simple_salesforce.api.SalesforceResourceNotFound: Resource ListView Not Found. Response content: [{u'errorCode': u'NOT_FOUND', u'message': u'The requested resource does not exist'}]

items.title: Assignment Rule Header - disable the default rule?
items.body:
Thank you all for your hard work, great tool ..
 (this may not be a feature enhancement.. just me thinking too hard.. on a Friday..)

 I'm triggering a condition with my updates that cause the "owner" to change due to the [Default Assignment rule](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_rest.meta/api_rest/headers_autoassign.htm) in SF. According to the [Restful API documentation](https://resources.docs.salesforce.com/sfdc/pdf/api_rest.pdf) one can pass a header to change this default behavior:

Sforce-Auto-Assign: FALSE

however in api.py:

```
def _call_salesforce(self, method, url, **kwargs):
    """Utility method for performing HTTP call to Salesforce.

    Returns a 'requests.result' object.
    """
    headers = {
        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        'Authorization': 'Bearer ' + self.session_id,
        'X-PrettyPrint': '1'
    }
    result = self.request.request(method, url, headers=headers, **kwargs)
```

am I missing an obvious way to append to the header or would it be beneficial to add a convention to include additional header items?

items.title: Expose API usage
items.body:
The Salesforce API returns a usage report in the header of each response, as detailed in the documentation: https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_rest.meta/api_rest/headers_api_usage.htm
it looks something like `Sforce-Limit-Info: api-usage=18/5000`. 

It would be very helpful to be able to track our API usage, but it doesn't look like the simple-salesforce library exposes this information. I'd like to add a variable to instances of `Salesforce` objects that gets updated in `_call_salesforce()`, and potentially a similar variable in `SFType` objects that transfers to the `Salesforce` object in the `__getattr__` method. Are there any other methods I should account for in this change?

`File "/Users/waveoc1-3/PycharmProjects/ecommerce-core/env/lib/python3.4/site-packages/simple_salesforce/api.py", line 92, in __init__

simple_salesforce.login.SalesforceAuthenticationFailed: UNSUPPORTED_CLIENT: TLS 1.0 has been disabled in this organization. Please use TLS 1.1 or higher when connecting to Salesforce using https.`
Cannot connect to Salesforce with enabled TLS 1.1 with last version of simple-salesforce on Python 3.4/3.5 (OS X 10.11.5).

items.title: Queries take long or timeout
items.body: Hi, whenever I make SOQL queries with my code with about 10 minutes in between them, the queries suddenly take much longer and will sometimes timeout. Do you guys have any suggestions on how to approach this with simple-salesforce?

items.title: Split services
items.body:
There's currently a mix of services implemented directly in `simple_salesforce.Salesforce` (i.e. apex and sobjects). This should be changed such that `simple_salesforce.Salesforce` contains references to service implementations, such as `Salesforce.bulk`, `Salesforce.sobjects`, `Salesforce.reports`, `Salesforce.apex`, etc.

As a part of this, the existing APIs should be deprecated (use `warnings.warn(..., DeprecationWarning)`) and removed in a future version.
